author: The Australian
title: Telstra signs Equinix colocation deal
text:
Australian enterprises are estimated to spend over $2.5bn on data centres in 2015, up from $2.3bn in 2014.
Equinix said it was capitalising on this rising demand with its newly opened ME1 data centre in Melbourne and SY4 in Sydney, which is due to be completed in Q2 2016, and this new agreement that is aimed at helping local firms safeguard data with high levels of security and operational reliability.
Equinix’s managing director for Australia and New Zealand Jeremy Deutsch said, “As Australia’s largest telecommunications provider, Telstra has a unique understanding of Australian’s data centre needs.
“This agreement enables Telstra customers’ access to the world’s most interconnected data centres, accelerating business performance, generating revenue opportunities and reducing time-to-market,” he said.
“We’re delighted to be delivering Equinix’s premium data centre services to Telstra customers, directly through Telstra.”
Telstra cloud executive Michael Riad said, “Telstra’s agreement with Equinix gives our customers’ access to five more data centre collocation sites, which means we have more points of presence across Australia and multiple data centre locations in the same state. This is great news for customers who require high-availability and compliance from their collocation services.”
Mr Riad said in 2014, Telstra added two new Points-of-Presence (PoP) in Equinix’s SY3 data centre in Sydney, and in its ME1 data centre in Melbourne.
Telstra also has PoPs in Equinix’s other Sydney data centres as well as in Hong Kong, Singapore, and Tokyo.
The move comes amid a wave of local data centre efforts as the market for enterprise cloud computing services heats up. IBM last month lit up a data centre in Melbourne for its SoftLayer cloud computing service and will build a second centre in Sydney.
Microsoft has invested in local infrastructure for its Azure cloud platform and others such as Amazon Web Services, Dimension Data, SAP and Dell are already operating cloud and data centre platforms here.
